page.title: 04The almshouses, Hilmarton
page.content: In Hilmarton there are a row of what we call almshouses, but in 1976 their name was changed to trust houses. The residents are today called licensees. The almshouses belong to the church commissioners and were built by William Henry Poynder in 1875 for people over 65. Today Mrs Kirkpatrick looks after the almshouses and collects the rent. There are five houses and there is one television aerial between them. At the moment there are five ladies who are living there.These are Mrs Hemmings, Mrs Dobson, Miss Hathway, Mrs Kirkpatrick and Mrs Taylor. In 1976 there was Â£24,000 of work done to the houses. The Vicar and Churchwardens are also responsible for the decoration, brickwork and gardening. Mrs Kirkpatrick pays for the water bill and the common central heating system.
